title: 105_hr2949
content: MISSOURI AND MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI RIVERS ENHANCEMENT PROJECT. The definitions in this section include the Middle Mississippi River, Missouri River, project, and Secretary. The Secretary of the Army is responsible for developing a plan to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River and the middle Mississippi River within 180 days of the enactment of this Act. The plan will include activities necessary for this purpose. The Secretary of the Army must develop a plan to enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region while considering water-related needs and private property rights. The plan will involve modifying and improving activities. The plan involves modifying and improving navigation training structures, creating side channels, restoring island habitat, and creating riverine habitat to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region. The plan includes establishing criteria for prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness and success likelihood, as well as physical and biological monitoring to evaluate project success. The Secretary will implement these activities using available funds. The Secretary will carry out activities described in the plan to design and construct project features using existing authority to accelerate completion. The Secretary will accelerate activities to protect fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River or middle Mississippi River, integrating them with other Federal and State activities. The Secretary will accelerate activities to protect fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River or middle Mississippi River, integrating them with other Federal and State activities. Existing authority preserves the project for mitigation of fish and wildlife losses, Missouri River Bank Stabilization and Navigation Project, authorized by the Water Resources Development Act of 1986. The section does not confer new regulatory authority on any entity carrying out activities authorized by the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 or any other existing authority. Public participation is required in developing and implementing the plan. The Secretary must ensure public participation by providing advance notice of meetings, allowing public input and comment, maintaining records, and compiling meeting proceedings. Compliance with applicable Federal laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act, is required for activities under the plan. Cost sharing for projects under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 requires a non-Federal share not exceeding 25% and a Federal share capped at $5,000,000 per activity. Operation and maintenance are the Federal responsibility, with authorization of appropriations for funding. Authorized appropriation of $50,000,000 for fiscal years 1999 through 2004 to fund activities managed by the Mississippi Valley Division of the Army Corps of Engineers.
